N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 702.7 - Emergency and disaster preparedness

State Regulations

Medical facilities shall have an acceptable written plan, rehearsed and updated at least twice a year, with procedures to be followed for
the proper care of patients and employees, including the reception and
treatment of mass casualty victims, in the event of an internal or external
emergency or disaster arising from the interruption of normal services
resulting from earthquake, tornado, flood, bomb threat, strike, interruption of
utility services and similar occurrences. All employees are to be trained in
all aspects of preparedness for any interruption of services and for any
disaster. Notes
